title.narrative: OUTPUT 6: DEMAND CREATION & PARTNERSHIPS

description.narrative: Stronger capacity among public and private sector and civil society actors to promote nutritional well-being of children, adolescents and women., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more children, adolescent girls and women of childbearing age access and utilize nutrition services, nutrient-rich foods and supplements to improve their well-being

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Stronger capacity among public and private sector and civil society actors to promote nutritional well-being of children,adolescents and women.

description.narrative: UNICEF sustained partnerships encompassing public and private to improve breastfeeding and complementary feeding practices in Ghana as well as increase uptake of essential nutrition services. Over40 private sector companies were engaged to support Family Friendly at workplaces and specifically promote, support and protect breastfeeding at workplace and partnership with the First Lady and Queen mothers to advocate for increased the uptake of the Girl’s Iron Folate Tablet Supplementation (GIFTS) contributed to reaching over 2.5 million adolescent girls 10-19 years with IFA in 2021 from 900,000 in 2020.; ;;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2022
